title: No children nodes listed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
description: When using the data set editor page in the query tab, changing the data source for a data set does not cause the children nodes to be listed.
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, no children nodes are listed.
EB: The expected result is that when the data source is changed, the new data source should list its children nodes.
SR:
1. Open the query tab in the application.
2. Go to the data set editor page.
3. Select a data set.
4. Change the data source associated with the data set.
5. Verify if the children nodes of the new data source are listed. If not, this issue is reproduced.
